intro: Lissocarpa tetramera, commonly known as the four-rayed lissocarpa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Lissocarpa tetramera is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
